revision.text:
{{Wired embedded system |brand=Planex |model=BRL-04 |revision=UR |asin= |manuf_country= |manuf=Alpha Networks |manuf_model=RG-03 |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=router, print server |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Realtek |cpu1_model=RTL8650B |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=2 |fla1_brand=Spansion |fla1_model= |ram1=16 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=HY57V281620ETP-H |expansion_if_types=USB 1.1 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=100M |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=0000 |oui_eth=00:90:CC }} {{TagLine|4Port Ethernet Broadband Router w/ USB Print Server}} :[http://www.planex.net/product/router/brl-04ur.htm Product page] â€¢ [http://www.planex.net/pdf/router/BRL-04UR_Manual_v1.3_Eng.pdf Manual] (EN)
The firmware provided by ''[[Planex]]'' is a .bix file, indicating likely use of a ''[[Realtek]]'' RTL865x SoC. :[http://www.fenix.ne.jp/~thomas/memo/brl-04ur/index.html ''Hack BRL-04UR''] seems to indicate this is a correct assumption :*"8WR03....0B1" is silkscreened on the board. :*RTL8650B + 2MB Flash + 16MB RAM, has serial header - (38400 8N1)
Additional specifications, per ''Planex'''s datasheet, follow... *Dimensions (W x H x D): [[Dimensions::100 mm x 150 mm x 30 mm]] *Weight: [[Weight::200 g]]
===Known security vulnerabilities=== *This device appears to be affected by the [[xmlset_roodkcableoj28840ybtide]] backdoor.
